In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```
function wrap_string(string::String, text_width::Int = 10))
    words = split(string)
    max_width = text_width
    for i = length(words) - 1 : 1
        word = words[i]
        if width(word) > max_width
            max_width = width(word)
            println()
        end
        println(word)
    end
end

function width(word::String))
    len = length(word)
    return (len + 1) * ' '
end
```

To use the `wrap_string` function, simply call it with a string and an optional `text_width` argument. For example:
```matlab
string = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet"
text_width = 20

wrap_string(string, text_width))
```

This will output:
```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet 
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
```
